Questions.QuestionString: What is the most type pump using for oil system?

Magnetic chip detectors are small filter which are in contact with the scavenge oil. They collect particles of magnetic metal which are passing through the oil

Questions.QuestionString: The supply pump is driven by?
Answers: The supply pump is driven by the N2 rotor system via the gearbox
The supply pump is driven by the N1 rotor system via the gearbox

Questions.QuestionString: Which is statement correct?
Answers:
Most large jet engines use fuel cooled oil coolers as the primary coolers
because they are efficient and small.

Most large jet engines use fuel cooled oil coolers as the secondary coolers
because they are efficient and small.

Some large jet engines use air cooled oil coolers as primary coolers to

Questions.QuestionString: What are main tasks of the engine fuel distribution subsystem?
Answers: Pressurize fuel sufficiently for vaporizing in combustion chamber
Heat fuel for anti icing, supply fuel to the engines, pressurize fuel sufficiently for vaporizing in combustion chamber

Questions.QuestionString:
what is component using for measuring the actual fuel flow and
transmits signals to the cockpit for the fuel flow and fuel used indication.
What are kind of low pressure fuel pumps?
Answers: The fuel pumps are usually impeller type pumps driven by the accessory gearbox
The fuel pumps are usually gear type pumps driven by the accessory gearbox
The fuel pumps are usually piston type pumps driven by the accessory gearbox

Questions.QuestionString: What are kind of high pressure fuel pumps?
Answers: The gear type pump and the impeller type pump.
The gear type pump and the piston type pump.
The impeller type pump and the piston type pump.

Questions.QuestionString: What is main function of fuel nozzle?
Answers: To heat the fuel so that it vaporizes and burns as quickly as possible.
To atomize the fuel so that it vaporizes and burns as quickly as possible.
To regulate the fuel pressure so that it vaporizes and burns as quickly as possible.

Questions.QuestionString: What is main function of fuel control unit?
Answers: To meter the fuel necessary for all operating conditions of the engine
To meter the fuel necessary for take off operating conditions of the engine only
To regulate the fuel pressure necessary for all operating conditions of the engine

Questions.QuestionString: What is the idle speed?
Answers: Midle speed is the lowest speed at which an engine operates
Idle speed is the lowest speed at which an engine operates
Idle speed is the high speed at which an engine operates

Questions.QuestionString: What is FADEC stand for?
The engine air system can be divided into?
Purpose of the compressor control system?
Answers: Protects the engine compressors against stall and surge in all operating conditions and it increases their efficiency.
Optimizes the tip clearance between the rotor blades and the stator casing to increase the engine efficiency.
Makes sure that the internal and external engine components are cooled sufficiently during operation and after engine shut down.

Questions.QuestionString: Purpose of the clearance control system?
Answers: Protects the engine compressors against stall and surge in all operating conditions and it increases their efficiency.
Optimizes the tip clearance between the rotor blades and the stator casing to increase the engine efficiency.
Makes sure that the internal and external engine components are cooled sufficiently during operation and after engine shut down.

Questions.QuestionString: Purpose of The engine cooling system?
Answers: Protects the engine compressors against stall and surge in all operating conditions and it increases their efficiency.
Optimizes the tip clearance between the rotor blades and the stator casing to increase the engine efficiency.
Makes sure that the internal and external engine components are cooled sufficiently during operation and after engine shut down.

Questions.QuestionString: The subsystems of the compressor control system include:
Answers: The LP compressor bleed valve system and the HP compressor bleed valve system.
The variable stator vane system, the LP compressor bleed valve system.
The variable bleed valve system, the variable stator vane system, the HP compressor bleed valve system.

Questions.QuestionString: Clearance control systems are used to optimize the tip clearances in?
The engine cooling system can be divided into?
Answers: The external cooling system and the internal air system.

Questions.QuestionString: Common tasks of the internal air system are?
Answers: Internal sealing, vibration balancing and internal cooling.
Internal sealing, pressure balancing and internal cooling.

Questions.QuestionString: The main engine controls are?
Answers: The engine start controls, the forward thrust controls and speed governor controls.
The engine start controls, the forward thrust controls and the reverse thrust controls.
The forward thrust controls, the reverse thrust controls, speed governor controls.

Questions.QuestionString: The mechanical thrust control system transmits?
Answers: The thrust lever input signals to the fuel control unit on the engine.
The start lever input signals to the hydraulic mechanical unit on the engine.
The thrust lever input signals to the hydraulic mechanical unit on the engine.

Questions.QuestionString: The forward thrust control system is used to?
Answers: Accelerate, decelerate and shut down the engine.
Accelerate and shut down the engine.
Accelerate and decelerate the engine. It can not be used to shut down the engine.

Questions.QuestionString: Electrical thrust control systems use?
Answers: Electrical signals to transmit the thrust demand signal from the thrust control levers in the cockpit to the engines.
Electrical signals to transmit the thrust demand signal from the start control levers in the cockpit to the engines.
Mechanical signals to transmit the thrust demand signal from the thrust control levers in the cockpit to the engines.

Questions.QuestionString: Electrical reverse thrust controls have?
Answers: A reverse thrust lever, a mechanical and an electrical signal transmission, a reverser interlock system, a lever lock system and control switches.
A reverse thrust lever, a mechanical and an electrical signal transmission, a reverser interlock system, two lever locks system and control switches.
A reverse thrust lever, two mechanicals and an electrical signal transmission, a reverser interlock system, a lever lock system and control switches.

Questions.QuestionString: The reverse thrust lever has?
To generate high energy sparks the ignition system needs the following components?
Answers: The ignition exciter and electrical power supply only.
The ignition leads and the control switches only.
The ignition exciter, the igniter plug, the ignition leads, the electrical power supply and the control switches.

engine thrust value?

Questions.QuestionString: What type of mixture water can be used in engine water injection system?
Afterburning engine consists of the introduction and burning of fuel in:

Questions.QuestionString: Afterburning engine will accelerate the airflow of:
Answers: Both the primary and secondary airstreams.

Questions.QuestionString: What is purpose of APU?

Supplies reverse thrust and electrical power for the different aircraft systems

Questions.QuestionString: What is main purpose of the compressor of the power section?

Provide the air for the combustion

Questions.QuestionString: A hung start is indicated by?
Answers: Exhaust gas temperature exceeds specified limits.

Questions.QuestionString: A hot start is indicated by?
Answers: Exhaust gas temperature exceeds specified limits.

Questions.QuestionString: When an engine is stall, EGT indication will?

Answers: The bleed pressure is low or The starter cut out too early
The bleed pressure is low or The starter cut out too late
The bleed pressure is high or The starter cut out too early

Questions.QuestionString: When ECU detects a wet start, Starter valve will?

Answers: By opening of borescope ports on combustion chamber case
By opening of borescope ports on turbine case

Questions.QuestionString: When are magnetic chip detectors inspected?
Answers: Magnetic chip detectors are inspected at fixed intervals.
Magnetic chip detectors are inspected when the engine is sent to shop

Questions.QuestionString: The preservation for a period up to 30 days of an operable engine. Which is correct?
Answers: The thrust reverser does not operates
The thrust reverser does not operates if it was done during last engine operation

Questions.QuestionString: To preserve operable engine for period of up to 90 days, which is correct?
Answers: Service the oil tank with engine oil
Service the oil tank with engine oil and corrosion preventive oil
Service the oil tank with engine oil and fuel

Questions.QuestionString: To preserve operable engine for period of up to 90 days, which is correct?
Answers: The fuel system need not be preserved
The fuel system must be preserved
The fuel system must be preserved if the Aircraft is not in the Hangar
